item.title: Ways To Switch Between Keyboard Layouts in bspwm
item.content:
Since bspwm doesn’t handle any keyboard input we need to use a third party program such as, sxhkd or polybar to switch between keyboard layouts.

First we need to create a script. Here is an example for a script that switch between English and Arabic:

#!/bin/bash

# Switching between keyboard layouts

CURRENT_LAYOUT=$(setxkbmap -query | awk 'NR==3{print $2}')

if [ "$CURRENT_LAYOUT" = "us" ]; then
  # To switch to arabic
    setxkbmap "ar"
else
    setxkbmap "us"
fi

Then, make the script executable using chmod +x

sxhkd

In the sxhkdrc file, add new keybinding:

# Switch keyboard language
alt + space
	[the script].sh

Polybar

Add new module in the plybar config file.

######################################
[module/toggle_kb]
type = custom/script
exec = echo 'Toggle KB |'
click-left = [the script].sh
######################################

Then, whenever you click the module in the bar, it will switch between the languages predefined in the script.
